Package ci

Class FileIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • ci.FileIO
  • public class FileIO
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for file input/output Have functions for creating the log files and index files

      FileIO()

        public FileIO()

    • Method Detail

      • constructLog

        public static void constructLog​(java.lang.String sha,
                                java.lang.String buildLog,
                                java.lang.String filepath,
                                java.lang.String link)
        Call this function after building the project. It creates a log-file with the sha-code, a link to the github-commit, and the build log Then it updates the index.html with the new build log
        Parameters:
        sha - The SHA code for the commit
        buildLog - The build log for the commit
        filepath - Path to the parent folder where the logs are stored
        link - The http-link to the github repo Format: "https://github.com/[organisation]]/[repo]"

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile​(java.lang.String filename,
                               java.lang.String content,
                               java.lang.String filepath)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This function takes a filename and a path and writes the content to that file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file that should be written to
        content - The content that should be written to the file
        filepath - The path to where the file should be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - FileWriter

      • createFolder

        public static void createFolder​(java.lang.String pathname)
                         throws java.io.InvalidObjectException
        Creates a folder at specified path
        Parameters:
        pathname - filepath where the folder should be created
        Throws:
        java.io.InvalidObjectException - throws error if the folder could not be created.

      • deleteFolder

        public static void deleteFolder​(java.lang.String pathname)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Delete folder and subfolders and files at specified path [Warning] Recursively deletes content of folder before deleting the folder
        Parameters:
        pathname - Path to start deleting
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if one item cannot be deleted

      • createLogHTML

        public static java.lang.String createLogHTML​(java.lang.String sha,
                                             java.lang.String buildLog,
                                             java.lang.String link)
        Create the html file as a String representation that represent the build log by adding a link to the github commit showing the build log
        Parameters:
        sha - SHA code for the github commit
        buildLog - The buildlog for the commit
        Returns:
        The HTML page as a string with the build information, sha, and link to github.

      • createIndexHTML

        public static java.lang.String createIndexHTML​(java.io.File[] pathnames)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a top level index file that is populated with links to the log files
        Parameters:
        pathnames - Array of Files that the index should link to
        Returns:
        the HTML page as a string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - from Files.readAttributes or Paths.get

      • contentOfFile

        public static java.lang.String contentOfFile​(java.io.File pathname)
                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                             java.io.IOException
        Adds the content of a file to a string and returns it
        Parameters:
        pathname - The file that we want to inspect
        Returns:
        The content of the file as a string
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - from FileReader
        java.io.IOException - from BufferedReader.readLine()

      • listFileNames

        public static java.io.File[] listFileNames​(java.lang.String folderPath)
        Lists the files in the requested folder. Returns an array of the content as a File-array, or null if empty
        Parameters:
        folderPath - The folder we want to look at
        Returns:
        An array of File with all files in the folder or an empty array if the folder is empty or the value null if the folder does not exist
